description: Consider an n X n board with a knight's path, not necessarily closed, that visits every square exactly once; number the squares [ 1..n^2 ] along the path; a(n) = maximal number of prime numbered squares that can be attacked by a queen.
links: Chris K. Caldwell and G. L. Honaker, Jr., Prime Curio for 18
Echolalie, Le Probleme de Honaker resolu pour n=9
M. Keith, The Prime Queen Attack Problem
author: _G. L. Honaker, Jr._, Nov 15 1998
extensions: a(9) and a(10) from _Jacques Tramu_, Mar 28 2004
